prompt: In the context of XWiki I'm receiving lot's of notifications about all kinds of pages I'm not interested in. These seem to have been enabled automatically. How can I disable these notifications?
expected_answer: By default, a page where you have made a major modification is automatically added to the list of pages you watch. It means you will be notified about changes on your work. You can change the setting for "Automatic page watching" in the notification settings in your user profile. You can delete existing notification filters that were created this way in the "Custom Filters" list in the notification settings in your user profile.

Based on the search results, I can help you manage your notifications in XWiki. Here's how you can handle this situation:

### Understanding the Default Behavior
- In XWiki versions before 15.5, the whole wiki is watched by default for new users, which can lead to receiving many unwanted notifications
- In XWiki 15.5+, nothing is watched by default for new users

### How to Manage Your Notifications

1. **Access Notification Settings**:
   - Click on the notifications menu
   - Look for and click the "settings" link

2. **Disable Notification Types**:
   - You can enable/disable specific types of notifications
   - Look for the bell icons associated with each application
   - Click the bells to disable notifications for entire applications you're not interested in

3. **Configure Filters**:
   - You can add filters to reduce the number of notifications
   - By default, you can filter out:
     - Minor events
     - Your own events
     - Events you've marked as read

4. **Stop Watching Specific Areas**:
   - Review what pages/spaces you're currently watching
   - Unwatch areas you're not interested in

### Important Note
- Changes you make to notification settings will only affect future notifications
- You'll still receive notifications for things you explicitly follow or when you're mentioned
- By default, you only receive notifications when:
  - You are mentioned
  - Actions are performed on pages you created or updated

These adjustments should help reduce the number of unwanted notifications you receive.

## Get a notification RSS feed

You can get a RSS feed of the notifications occurring in your wiki. This feed can be accessed either through a link in your notification tray (or at the bottom of the notifications macro).

![NotificationTrayRSSLink.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationTrayRSSLink.png?rev=1.3)  
![NotificationsWithRSS.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsWithRSS.png?rev=1.3)

## Notifications Macro

The [Notifications Macro is provided by its own application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Macro/).

# Settings

On the notifications menu, you also have a link to go to the "settings" of the notifications.

![notif4.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif4.png?rev=1.8)

By default, users only get notifications when they are mentioned or when actions are performed on pages they created or updated. For receiving other notifications, you need to select which "types" of notifications you want to receive. When a page is created? When a blog post is published?

You can enable or disable all notification types that belong to a particular application by clicking on the bells associated to this application. If some types are enabled and other are disabled inside an application, the switch looks like the next screenshot, meaning that the application's notifications are partially enabled:

![NotifUndeterminate.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotifUndeterminate.png?rev=1.3)

Note that you only receive notifications that occur after you turn on the notifications types.

### Follow a user

If you go to the [profile of an user](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/User%20Profile%20Application), using the [User Index](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/User%20Directory%20Application) for example, you can see decide to watching a user. It means you will receive all notifications about events triggered by this user.

![watchUser01.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/watchUser01.png?rev=1.3)  
![watchUser02.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/watchUser02.png?rev=1.3)  
![watchUser03.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/watchUser03.png?rev=1.3)  
![watchUser04.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/watchUser04.png?rev=1.3)

In your user profile, if you go to the "network" tab, you can see the list of users you are watching and the events that have performed:

![FollowedUsers.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/FollowedUsers.png?rev=1.4)

### Default Watch Settings

XWiki <15.5 By default for new users the whole wiki is watched. However, by default in this version, there's no application type enabled for notifications, except specific ones like Mention. This means that new users won't receive notifications, until they started to watch something and enabled some applciation types. There is a mechanism to automatically enable some application types whenever the users perform editions.

XWiki 15.5+ Starting with this version, by default nothing is watched for new users. However, all application types are now enabled. So users will keep not receiving anything, until they started to watch something.

![notifications-filters-settings.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notifications-filters-settings.png?rev=1.4)  
![notification-add-filter.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notification-add-filter.png?rev=1.1)



XWiki 14.1+ Note that the "System Event" filter doesn't filter out events that target the user *explicitly*.

### Hidden (technical) pages

**Filters that concern hidden pages are not shown in the table**, unless you have [enabled the option to see hidden pages](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/User%20Profile%20Application#HEditPreferences). That is why you can end up in a situation where filters exist but are not listed there.

### Filter your own events

By default, one don't receive notification about one's own activity (XWiki 14.1+ unless the event that triggered the notification targets *explicitly* that user). You have the ability to disable this filter in the "Advanced filtering options" section of your own notification settings. It's a per user setting, not a global one.

![OwnEventFilter.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/OwnEventFilter.png?rev=1.3)

### Filter events that you have marked as read

You can hide the notifications that you have marked as "read", so they won't appear anymore in the notifications menu nor in the emails.

![NotificationReadFilter.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationReadFilter.png?rev=1.3)

### Filter minor events

Minor events are not displayed on the notifications. But you can disable this filter.

![FilterMinorEvent.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/FilterMinorEvent.png?rev=1.3)

#-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  
  
#-# [Since 9.4RC1]  
#-# Indicates if the notification module should be enabled on the platform.  
#-#  
#-# The default is :  
# notifications.enabled = true## Enable and disable the email feature

The administrator can disable the "email" notifications by editing the configuration variable "notifications.emails.enabled" in xwiki.properties and restarting the server. 

#-# [Since 9.5C1]  
#-# Indicates if the notifications module can send emails.  
#-#  
#-# The default is :  
# notifications.emails.enabled = trueIn case you have scalability issues with the feature, please contact us to describe your problem. In any case, disabling the notification emails could help.

## Customize live email notifications grace time

The wiki users can receive live email notifications when an event is triggered in the wiki. In order to reduce the load on the server and on your MTA, you can define a live notification grace time in xwiki.properties with the variable notifications.emails.live.graceTime. The server should be restarted for the changes to take effect.

#-# [Since 9.6RC1]  
#-# Indicate the grace time used when sending live email notifications.  
#-# When an event is triggered in the wiki (for example, a document update), the platform will wait X minutes  
#-# before sending live notifications emails. During this time, if events of the same kind are recieved, they will  
#-# be grouped in the same email.  
#-#  
#-# The grace time define the period (in minutes) for which the platform should wait before sending a notification  
#-# mail after an event.  
#-#  
#-# The default is :

# Administrators

Administrators can go to Administration > Notifications to configure some settings about the notifications.

![NotificationsAdministration.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsAdministration.png?rev=1.5)

Some properties can be overridden by users. The inheritance is "Main Wiki preferences < Current Wiki preferences < User preferences".

XWiki 13.2+ Administrators can also directly change users' notification settings by going to their profile and click on "Notifications" tab in the menu. The UI is the same as what the user is seeing to customize their own notification settings.

## Enabling notifications for all users by default

In the administration, you can select which application and/or event types should be enabled by default for all users. 

## Choosing the default frequency of notification emails

XWiki 14.10+ Administrators can select the default frequency used for sending emails to users about the changes that have happened on the wiki. This frequency is set to *Daily* by default.

## Choosing the default level of details about the changes in the email

Administrators can select the level of details that users receive on the email, about the changes that have happened to the wiki.

## Choosing the default auto-watched mode

Administrators can select what is the default auto watching page behavior.

![AutoWatchModeAdmin.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/AutoWatchModeAdmin.png?rev=1.3)

You can also edit the xwiki.properties file:

#-# [Since 9.11.8]  
#-# [Since 10.6RC1]  
#-# The automatic watch mode used by default. The value can be changed by an administrator in the wiki's administration  
#-# or by any user in their own settings.  
#-#  
#-# Possible values:  
#-#  
#-# - none:  no page is added to the list of watched pages automatically.

## Override default notification templates in wiki pages

A wiki administrator can change the way notifications are displayed in the notification tray using the [NotificationDisplayerClass XObject](http://www.github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-notifications/xwiki-platform-notifications-default/src/main/java/org/xwiki/notifications/internal/WikiNotificationDisplayerDocumentInitializer.java). You can get more informations about this feature in the [Notifications API documentation](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Module/#HCreatecustomnotificationtemplates).

# Prerequisites & Installation Instructions

We recommend using the [Extension Manager](http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extension+Manager+Application) to install this extension (Make sure that the text "Installable with the Extension Manager" is displayed at the top right location on this page to know if this extension can be installed with the Extension Manager). Note that installing Extensions when being offline is currently not supported and you'd need to use some [complex manual method](https://xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Installation/#HOthermethods).

You can also use the following manual method, which is useful if this extension cannot be installed with the Extension Manager or if you're using an old version of XWiki that doesn't have the Extension Manager:

1. Log in the wiki with a user having Administration rights
2. Go to the Administration page and select the Import category
3. Follow the on-screen instructions to upload the downloaded XAR
4. Click on the uploaded XAR and follow the instructions
5. You'll also need to install all [dependent Extensions](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HDependencies) that are not already installed in your wiki
